subject: Re: [junit] Re: Are you really using JUnit during your developmen t?
msgSnippet: ... Developer (unit) testing, sure. But not the other kinds of testing (integration, acceptance, etc...), which are typically done by people other than the
messageBody:
On 8/4/06, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric Beust:
>
> > What makes someone a bad professional is when they put a task at the top
> of
> > their priority regardless of the context.
>
> Testing is not a task of its own. It's an inherent part of coding.


Developer (unit) testing, sure.

But not the "other" kinds of testing (integration, acceptance, etc...),
which are typically done by people other than the developers. You need to
plan, schedule and sometimes supervise that as well.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
